subject: Coaches and Managers
Hiring and Promotion
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Sean Miller of Xavier has accepted the head coaching job at Arizona, ending the Wildcats’ sometimes frustrating search for a high-profile replacement for the Hall of Famer Lute Olson. The university announced the hiring after a confusing few hours in which it was first reported by several news media outlets that Miller had turned down the job. Miller, 40, was scheduled to be introduced Tuesday at a news conference in Tucson. He led the Musketeers to the Round of 8 of the N.C.A.A. tournament last year and received a contract extension through the 2017-18 season. Xavier reached the Round of 16 this season. ¶Memphis has hired Josh Pastner, an assistant under John Calipari, as the Tigers’ coach. The university scheduled a news conference for Tuesday to introduce Pastner, 31. Calipari left Memphis for Kentucky last week after nine seasons with the Tigers. Pastner, who is regarded as a top recruiter, worked one year under Calipari after six years as an assistant at Arizona. memphis.
